New Records: L. Thomas hit a grand slam in the 5th inning, a rare feat in the MLB playoffs.
Key Match Events: Thomas hits grand slam off Skubal, Guardians down Tigers 7-3 to reach AL Championship Series
L. Thomas homered to left center (396 feet), Kwan scored, Fry scored and Ramírez scored.
Post-Match Reflections: For the third time in less than a month, the Cleveland Guardians made a semi-circle in the middle of their clubhouse and emptied champagne and beer bottles on each other as “Rocky Top” blasted through the speakers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Progressive Field in Cleveland, Ohio, with an attendance of 34,105.
The Cleveland Guardians won the series 3-2, advancing to the AL Championship Series.
Others: The Guardians' victory was marked by a strong performance from their offense, led by L. Thomas's grand slam.
Tarik Skubal took the loss for the Tigers, allowing 5 earned runs in 6 innings.
